item.title: Jeremy add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "If a man's at odds to know his own mind it's because he hasn't got aught but his mind to know it with." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Jeremy add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "Philosophy, art, and science are not the mental objects of an objectified brain but the three aspects under which the brain becomes subject." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Jeremy add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Peering down into the water where the morning sun fashioned wheels of light, coronets fanwise in which lay trapped each twig, each grain of sediment, long flakes and blades of light in the dusty water sliding away like optic strobes where motes sifted and spun." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Jeremy add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Jeremy add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Who claims Truth, Truth abandons. History is hir'd, or coerc'd, only in Interests that must ever prove base. She is too innocent, to be left within the reach of anyone in Power,- who need but touch her, and all her Credit is in the instant vanish'd, as if it had never been. She needs rather to be tended lovingly and honorably by fabulists and counterfeiters, Ballad-Mongers and Cranks of ev'ry Radius, Masters of Disguise to provide her the Costume, Toilette, and Bearing, and Speech nimble enough to keep her beyond the Desires, or even the Curiosity, of Government." -- Thomas Pynchon
